blog.name: thephandommonthly
blog.title: The Phandom Monthly
blog.description:
A magazine that is published monthly by members of the Phandom. This is meant to keep everyone up to date as to what is going on within the world of Dan and Phil and their "phans".

View All the Magazines | Meet the Admins

summary: Even though the content in the phandom has been sparse, we are still producing content of our own and we need more hands on...
body:
Even though the content in the phandom has been sparse, we are still producing content of our own and we need more hands on deck, as right now, we only have a few writers!

We’re looking to add a couple more writers and editors for permanence on the magazine to be admins! We have an application for you to fill out and to ensure that you’re serious about wanting to be an admin, we’ve added a few things for you do to show us what you can do!  We’ll be choosing 2-3 writers and 1-2 editors!  Due to the lack of responses, we are going to be changing the apps a bit, meaning there are no mock article/cover asked of you, and extending the closing date to May 25th! If you already have applied, you do not need to reapply! 

Author Applications 

Some qualities and quirks of the job are:

  • You get to work with fantastic people. Seriously. You’ll love us.
  • You’ll have pretty much free-hand at what you want to write about, as long as it’s about Dan and Phil obviously.
  • You’ll help research ideas with us, pitch ideas, and write them.
  • You’ll have great experience when it comes to actually working in a job since this is a job.

Editor Application
* You will need to have access to iCloud OR to Apple’s software Pages as this is where the magazine is edited. 

Some qualities and quirks of the job are:

  • You get to work with fantastic people. Seriously. You’ll love us.
  • You’ll have access to the magazine itself and per Alex, will be able to help tweak the photos and the formatting!
  • You’ll help research ideas with us, pitch ideas, and write them.
  • You’ll have great experience when it comes to actually working in a job since this is a job.

Pinch Hitter Form

On the flip side, we’re also looking to have writers on standby! So recently the writers of the magazine have found it hard to complete what they need to due to prior commitments so we need people to step in and take their place for that month! This will not be an admin position. We will add you though to the magazine chat if you wish! And if an admin can’t get an article done, or we have articles left over and you wish to pick one up, that is when you will come in!

blog.name: 8-bitpig
blog.title: World's Coolest Bean
blog.description: Whomst'd've

summary: Unpopular Opinion: The Phandom is one of the Most Invasive and Unhealthy Fandoms.
title: Unpopular Opinion: The Phandom is one of the Most Invasive and Unhealthy Fandoms.
body:
I found Dan and Phil a few months ago and loved their content (separate or collaborative), And in that time I’ve gotten progressively less and less happy about it. I didn’t plan on ranting but, here we go…

I like Dan and Phil. Not the Phandom. I have never seen a group of people more inappropriate and negative in my life. Some of them sprout sentiments like, “Dan and Phil deserve space” and, “We aren’t entitled to know what they are doing/do in general.” Then you scroll once and see a new “theory” post delving into the most private of matters.

Don’t get me wrong, I KNOW this isn’t every phan, but it is such a large number its hard to distinguish the “good ones”.

You can’t get on the Dan and Phil tag without seeing a phan (tbh) whining about the hiatus when Dan (only Dan that’s important) has only been gone for 5 months. He told you he was taking a break. Just because you assumed it would be 2 weeks doesn’t mean that’s what he needed or wanted.

People constantly compare the two. I am aware that people have spoken about this. But I’d like to give my two cents. I’ve seen a lot of posts saying, “Would people be treating the hiatus the same if it were Phil on the break?” I think not. I think people have (for some reason) chosen to fetishize Dan to such a length that they feel “the sensitive one” is missing. Protect Protect Protect! I think people think Phil has a lot more mental “strength” if you will and would not coddle him or fret so much about the hiatus as much if he were the one to have “left”. No wonder Dan didn’t tell you about his depression until half a decade passed.

I’ve also seen a saddening amount of posts saying things like, “I feel less happy/more depressed now that we aren’t getting as much content.” Or, “I feel like I don’t have a purpose/any fun without Dan and Phil.” Or, “My depression/anxiety has gotten worse since the hiatus.” …Oh My God. If your mental health is declining because you aren’t getting a new dose of your favorite youtubers you need to find help. I say this both in an incredulous way and in the most serious way a human could mean that sentence. You are relying FAR too much on a security blanket/obsession. If you’ve made and/or relate with a post like that I’d almost suggest not watching at all if I didn’t fear other (and worse) addictions might follow.

Seriously get help.

In short, I have never been involved in a fandom where the fandom put me off so quickly. The Phandom is extremely hypocritical and juvenile 90% of the time.

I will still watch Phil and wait for Dan. But I may never join the Phandom.

blog.name: dramaphan
blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.
